text: Where is the button that automatically generates a process chain?

options.A: In the app called Process Chain Editor
options.B: In the editor of a data transfer process

text: How does SAP position SAP Datasphere in supporting business users? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.A: Business users can create agile models from different sources.
options.B: Business users can leverage embedded analytic Fiori apps for data analysis.
options.C: Business users can allocate system resources without IT involvement.
options.D: Business users can create restricted calculated columns based on existing models.
options.E: Business users can upload their own CSV files.

options.A: Open Operational Data Store Layer
options.B: Data Acquisition Layer
options.C: Flexible Enterprise Data Warehouse Core Layer
options.D: Virtual Data Mart Layer

options.A: SAP ABAP Connection

text:
You use InfoObject B as a display attribute for InfoObject A.

text:
InfoObject "CITY" is defined as a display attribute for InfoObject "CUSTOMER" InfoObject "COUNTRY" is defined as a display attribute for InfoObject "CITY". In a master data report you want to display the "COUNTRY" of a "CUSTOMER".
Which options do you have to realize this scenario? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.A: Include "CUSTOMER" to the rows in the BW query on "CUSTOMER" activate the Universal Display Hierarchy setting
options.B: Generate external views for "CUSTOMER" "CITY" "COUNTRY" join them in another calculation view
options.C: Combine "CUSTOMER" "CITY" "COUNTRY" in a Composite Provider using a sequence of left outer join operators
options.D: Add "COUNTRY" as a transitive attribute for "CUSTOMER" in InfoObject definition
options.E: Combine "CUSTOMER" "CITY" "COUNTRY" in an Open ODS View using a sequence of associations

text: Which options do you have to combine data from SAP BW bridge a customer space in SAP Datasphere Core? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.A:
• Import SAP BW bridge objects to the SAP BW bridge space 
• Share the generated remote tables with the customer space 
• Create additional views in the customer space to combine data
options.B:
• Import SAP BW bridge objects to the customer space 
• Create additional views in the customer space to combine data
options.C:
• Import SAP BW bridge objects to the SAP BW bridge space 
• Create additional views in the customer space 
• Share the created views with the SAP BW bridge space to combine data
options.D:
• Import objects from the customer space to the SAP BW bridge space 
• Create additional views in the SAP BW bridge space to combine data

text:
The behavior of a modeled dataflow depends on:
	• The DataSource with its Delta Management method
	• The type of the DataStore object(advanced) used as a target
	• The update method of the key figures in the transformation
Which of the following combinations provides consistent information for the target? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.A: • DataSource with Delta Management method ADD • DataStore Object(advanced) type Standard • Update method Move
options.B: • DataSource with Delta Management method ABR • DataStore Object (advanced) type Stard • Update method Summation
options.C: • DataSource with Delta Management method ABR • DataStore Object (advanced) type Stard • Update method Move
options.D: • DataSource with Delta Management method ABR • DataStore Object (advanced) type Data Mart • Update method Summation
options.E: • DataSource with Delta Management method AIE • DataStore Object (advanced) type Data Mart • Update method Summation

options.A: Create transport requests
options.B: Set up Software components

text: What are the prerequisites for deleting business partner attribute master data in SAP BW/4HANA? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.D: In SAP BW/4HANA there must be no analysis authorizations related to business partner values that should be deleted

text:
An upper-level CompositeProvider compares current values with historic values based on a union operation. The current values are provided by a DataStore object (advanced) that is updated daily. Historic values are provided by a lower-level CompositeProvider that combines different open ODS views from DataSources.
What can you do to improve the performance of the BW queries that use the upper-level CompositeProvider? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.A: Replace the lower-level CompositeProvider with a new DataStore object (advanced) fill it with the same combination of historic data.
options.B: Use a join node instead of the Union node in the upper-level CompositeProvider.
options.C: Replace the DataStore object (advanced) for current data by an Open ODS view that accesses the current data directly from the source system.
options.D: Use the "Generate Dataflow" feature for the Open ODS views load the historic data to the new generated DataStore objects (advanced).

text: What are some of the variable types in a BW query that can use the processing type SAP HANA Exit? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.A: Hierarchy node
options.B: Formula
options.C: Text
options.D: Characteristic value

options.A: Calendar day
options.B: Request ID

options.D: Record mode

options.A: SAP BW/4HANA Model Transfer leverages BW Queries for model generation in SAP Datasphere.
options.B: Model Transfer can be leveraged from an On-premise environment to the cloud the other way around.
options.C: SAP BW bridge Model Transfer leverages BW Modeling tools to import entities into native SAP Datasphere.
options.D: SAP S/4HANA Model Transfer leverages ABAP CDS views for model generation in SAP Datasphere.

text: For which scenarios do you use the SAP HANA model focus? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.A: Load snapshots using ABAP CDS Views.
options.B: Build views procedures using SQL script.
options.C: Define ABAP Managed Database Procedures in data flows.
options.D: Define calculations using geospatial functions.

options.A: Splitting a complex transformation into simple parts without storing intermediate data
options.B: Providing the delta extraction information of the source data
options.C: Enabling a data transfer process (DTP) to process multiple sequential transformations
options.D: Realizing direct access to source data without storing them

options.A: Join two ABAP CDS views.
options.B: Create new calculated fields.
options.C: Define new restricted key figures.
options.D: Integrate SAP HANA calculation views.

text: You defined a condition in a BW query for the top 10 of 100 customers based on sales revenue. Using key figure properties in the BW query which two scenarios regarding result presentation can be achieved? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.A: One result row with the sales revenue sum of all 100 customers
options.B: One result row with the sales revenue sum of the top 10 customers a second result row with the sales revenue sum of all 100 customers
options.C: One result row with the sales revenue sum of the top 10 customers
options.D: One result row with the sales revenue sum of the top 10 customers a second result row with the sales revenue sum of the other 90 customers

options.A: You cannot use this characteristic as a navigation attribute for another characteristic.
options.B: You cannot use navigation attributes for this characteristic.
options.C: You cannot load more than 2 billion master data records for this characteristic.
options.D: You cannot use this characteristic as an external characteristic in hierarchies.

options.A: NumPy Pas are automatically converted to SQL script.
options.B: Python language can be used for complex transformation.
options.C: Data can be combined using Union or Join operators.
options.D: Remote tables can be used as target objects.
options.E: Target mode can be Append Truncate or Delete.

options.B: Data can be persisted by using real-time replication.
options.C: Data can be loaded using advanced transformation capabilities.
options.D: Data can be accessed virtually by remote access to the source system.

options.C: Leveraging SQL in-house knowledge

text: For what reasons is the start process a special type of process in a process chain? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.C: It can be a successor to another process.
options.D: It is the only process that can be scheduled without a predecessor.

text: What are the possible ways to fill a pre-calculated value set (bucket)? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.C: By using a transformation data transfer process (DTP)

text: What are some of the advantages of using SAP BW/4HANA business content? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

text: You create a Data Store object (advanced) using the "Data Mart DataStore Object" modeling property. Which behaviors are specific to this modeling property? Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

options.A: The change log table will be filled only after data activation.
options.B: Query results are shown only when data has been activated.
options.C: Reporting is done based on a union of the inbound active tables.
options.D: The records are treated as if all characteristics are in the key.

text: Which modeling decisions may have side effects on runtime performance? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

options.A: Use a transitive attribute instead of an attribute that is directly assigned to a characteristic.
options.B: Uncheck the "Write change log" property for a Stard DataStore Object.
options.C: Move a characteristic within a DataMart DataStore object to a different group.
options.D: Change a time-independent attribute of a characteristic to a time-dependent attribute.
options.E: Include a characteristic from the underlying DataMart DataStore Object in the CompositeProvider instead of a navigation attribute.
